page.title: 01GENERAL INTRODUCTION
page.content: The area covers the estuary of the River Colne,and the neighbouring countryside. The estuary is used by yachtsmen and trading vessels on their way to the Hythe at Colchester.It also includes the Pyefleet Channel,famous for its oyster beds since Roman times. The west bank comprises the Langenhoe marshes and the Geedon marshes at Fingringhoe.Partly M.O.D.land,these marshes are important nature reserves. The east bank at Brightlingsea is formed from marsh-land and high areas of glacial gravels.Gravel extraction and farming are the main occupations though other points of interest are the fine church and a toy factory. Brightlingsea attracts tourists.
